<a href="https://getdivvy.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=sponsored-email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=morning-brew-jan&utm_term=email&utm_content=sponsored-email" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Divvy " style="width:100%;max-width: 150px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="150" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY0NjA4OTY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>When our infallible economic model went 0–4 predicting NFL playoff games this weekend, we knew something was fishy. So what did we find when reviewing the algorithm? A single, misplaced negative sign that happened to flip every prediction. It all makes sense now :) </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/ces-2020-promises-new-entrants-framing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Only Vegas Show More Popular Than Cher
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="man playing ping pong with a robot " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=372 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26wkK7pYpmid0khz2/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="man playing ping pong with a robot " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26wkK7pYpmid0khz2/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The world’s biggest consumer tech event is here. CES (formerly the Consumer Electronics Show) doesn’t technically start until Tuesday, but the hype machine is knocking and we will submit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What began in 1967 as a small gadget fair is now a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/489a3dda-2e18-11ea-a126-99756bd8f45e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">much larger gadget fair</a>. 170,000 attendees are expected to head to Las Vegas for a glimpse of the future in fields like 5G, transportation, and virtual reality from 4,500 exhibiting companies. A Trump will speak (Ivanka). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">“CES isn’t what it used to be”...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...is something you often hear these days. It’s true, the biggest players like Apple, Samsung, and Amazon all have their own events for launching flagship products. Microsoft is MIA. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in its current iteration, CES offers a platform for “non-tech” companies to prove they know their way around a circuit board. Just look at this year’s <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/ces-2020-where-have-the-tech-companies-gone-2020-01-03?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keynote lineup</a>, which features execs from Delta Air Lines and consumer goods giant Unilever. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The framing, too, is different. While the public used to worship at the altar of tech, consumers are “increasingly interested not just in seeing new gadgets, but in how new products affect security, privacy and human rights,” Axios’s Ina Fried <a href="https://www.axios.com/ces-preview-speakers-announcements-100799b1-284e-4766-9e98-6cca0bf9891c.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>You can, for example, hear Salesforce co-CEO Marc Benioff speak on a </span><span><a href="https://www.ces.tech/conference/30557/630316.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">panel</a></span><span> called “Good for Business, Good for the Planet: How Companies Drive Positive Impact.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There will definitely be gadgets, though</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Smart cars, smart microwaves, smart bathrooms. 8K-resolution televisions from Samsung, LG, and China’s TCL (despite a lack of even 4K programming). Augmented reality glasses that could become mainstream with 5G technology. A <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/3/21047217/segway-s-pod-personal-vehicle-self-balancing-wheelchair-ces-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">self-balancing Segway wheelchair</a>. High-tech sex toys. Better plant-based meat. More sophisticated virtual assistants. And a whole lot more we don’t know yet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we’ll provide updates on the biggest (and weirdest) announcements throughout the week. You can also sign up for our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=emtech&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emerging Tech Brew</a> newsletter for on-the-ground news from Vegas.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/iranian-cyberattacks-wouldnt-anything-new?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Decade in Review: Iranian Cyberattack Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Map showing cyberattacks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjE5L21hcF9zaG93aW5nX2N5YmVyYXR0YWNrcy5KUEciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>U.S. Department of Defense</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With this new year came <a href="https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?q=draft%20age&geo=US&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a spike</a> in Google searches for “draft age.” That’s because a U.S. airstrike killed top Iranian general Qassem Suleimani, and Iran <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/thousands-mourn-those-killed-u-s-strikes-world-awaits-iran-n1110391?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vowed</a> to retaliate.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One form that retribution might take? Cyberattacks, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/01/03/cyber-attack-should-be-expected-us-strike-iranian-leader-sparks-fears-major-digital-disruption/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">experts say</a>. Over the past 10 years, Iranian hackers have proven they can throw a serious wrench into U.S. company operations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In 2012 and 2013, </strong>Iran responded to U.S. sanctions <a href="https://apnews.com/aa3ddd9dd24b79f8ec76aa1a6487e4fc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">by taking aim</a> at Wall Street. State-backed hackers <a href="https://money.cnn.com/2012/09/27/technology/bank-cyberattacks/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inundated</a> major financial institutions' websites with traffic, forcing them to shut down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In 2014,</strong> Iranian hackers <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-05/iranian-attack-on-adelson-provides-lesson-on-cyber-strategy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> a malware attack on the networks used by Sheldon Adelson’s Las Vegas casino after the mogul suggested the U.S. should drop a bomb in the Iranian desert. It cost at least $40 million to recover.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Just three months ago, </strong>Microsoft <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/04/iran-tried-hack-us-presidential-candidates-journalists-effort-that-targeted-hundreds-microsoft-finds/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> a group tied to Iran tried to hack into the email accounts of U.S. presidential campaign workers, government officials, and journalists. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The newest cyberweapon = disinformation. Last year, social platforms like Facebook and Twitter <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/07/25/its-not-just-russians-anymore-iranians-others-turn-up-disinformation-efforts-ahead-vote/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised alarm</a> about Iranian propaganda efforts.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/philadelphia-fed-projects-nine-states-will-enter-contraction?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Philadelphia Fed Is Not Handling the Eagles Loss Well
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Philadelphia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjI5L3BoaWxhZGVscGhpYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, the Philadelphia Fed published <a href="https://www.philadelphiafed.org/research-and-data/regional-economy/indexes/leading?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a report</a> that projected nine states’ economies will shrink in the next six months, the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-02/nine-states-face-economic-contraction-most-since-2009-crisis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest number</a> of states at risk of contraction since July 2009. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">West Virginia’s facing the biggest hit, and Pennsylvania’s expected decline would be its steepest since May 2009. That could be bad news for President Trump, who’s facing reelection and won Pennsylvania by the skin of his teeth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Every month, the Philadelphia Fed releases six-month growth projections based on figures like housing permits, initial unemployment claims, interest rate spreads, and manufacturing data from the Institute for Supply Management.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The bank had already projected shrinkage for Delaware, Montana, Oklahoma, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, and Alaska. This month, it added Vermont, New Jersey, Kentucky, and Connecticut, while changing its tune on Alaska.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bright side: </strong>This means the bank expects 41 states to grow and the national economy to maintain its record expansion, with support from low interest rates, a gangbusters labor market, and a pending "phase one" trade deal with China.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/dating-sunday-2020-projected-boost-matchmaking-apps?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Love at First Swipe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="woman using smartphone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4MjQwOTA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you see your single coworkers in finger splints this morning, cut them some slack. They were ferociously swiping yesterday on Dating Sunday, the <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/dating-sunday-tips-for-making-the-most-of-online-datings-busiest-day/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest day of the year</a> for online dating platforms. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Match projected 80% more user activity than average.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bumble predicted a 30% jump in new users.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Dating Sunday last year, the app Coffee Meets Bagel </span><span><a href="https://qz.com/1777921/the-best-day-to-be-active-on-dating-apps/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saw</a></span><span> a 61% increase in new user signups and a 22% increase in matches compared to the previous 30 days. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>The first Sunday of January has <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/01/02/dating-sunday-holiday-january-5-tips/2793853001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all the ingredients</a> of a potent love elixir. Sunday is already the most popular day for swiping, Valentine’s Day is fast approaching, and singles just made New Year’s resolutions to find the Morning to their Brew. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Online dating is big business. Match Group, which owns apps like Tinder, Hinge, and OkCupid, posted revenue of more than <a href="https://www.dallasnews.com/business/local-companies/2020/01/03/match-gears-up-for-another-record-breaking-weekend-of-online-dating-as-dating-sunday-approaches/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.7 billion</a> last year (mostly thanks to Tinder). Match is currently being <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/11/iac-shares-jump-after-it-announces-plans-to-spin-off-match-group.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spun off</a> by holding company IAC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>for those stuck on an opening line today, “Do you read Morning Brew?” has always worked for us.</p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>

<img alt="Picture of a Globe " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc3ODg5NTgyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not feeling the 2020's?</strong> We got you. Snuggle into the warm, familiar embrace of the 2010's with our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/decade-in-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Decade in Review</a>, an exploration of the past decade in business. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We rolled this series out over the holiday break and it earned much better reviews than <em>Star Wars </em>(even the <a href="https://twitter.com/marceloclaure/status/1213879584019689472?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new chairman of WeWork</a> was a fan). You'll see the best photos of the decade, relive all the most important trends, and try your hand at 2010's trivia. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/decade-in-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the Decade in Review</a>.</p>

Cher\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"man playing ping pong with a robot \" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe world’s biggest consumer tech event is here. CES (formerly the Consumer Electronics Show) doesn’t technically start until Tuesday, but the hype machine is knocking and we will submit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat began in 1967 as a small gadget fair is now a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/489a3dda-2e18-11ea-a126-99756bd8f45e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emuch larger gadget fair\u003c/a\u003e. 170,000 attendees are expected to head to Las Vegas for a glimpse of the future in fields like 5G, transportation, and virtual reality from 4,500 exhibiting companies. A Trump will speak (Ivanka). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e“CES isn’t what it used to be”...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...is something you often hear these days. It’s true, the biggest players like Apple, Samsung, and Amazon all have their own events for launching flagship products. Microsoft is MIA. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in its current iteration, CES offers a platform for “non-tech” companies to prove they know their way around a circuit board. Just look at this year’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/ces-2020-where-have-the-tech-companies-gone-2020-01-03?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekeynote lineup\u003c/a\u003e, which features execs from Delta Air Lines and consumer goods giant Unilever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe framing, too, is different. While the public used to worship at the altar of tech, consumers are “increasingly interested not just in seeing new gadgets, but in how new products affect security, privacy and human rights,” Axios’s Ina Fried \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/ces-preview-speakers-announcements-100799b1-284e-4766-9e98-6cca0bf9891c.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYou can, for example, hear Salesforce co-CEO Marc Benioff speak on a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ces.tech/conference/30557/630316.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epanel\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e called “Good for Business, Good for the Planet: How Companies Drive Positive Impact.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere will definitely be gadgets, though\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSmart cars, smart microwaves, smart bathrooms. 8K-resolution televisions from Samsung, LG, and China’s TCL (despite a lack of even 4K programming). Augmented reality glasses that could become mainstream with 5G technology. A \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/3/21047217/segway-s-pod-personal-vehicle-self-balancing-wheelchair-ces-2020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eself-balancing Segway wheelchair\u003c/a\u003e. High-tech sex toys. Better plant-based meat. More sophisticated virtual assistants. And a whole lot more we don’t know yet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’ll provide updates on the biggest (and weirdest) announcements throughout the week. Defense\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith this new year came \u003ca href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?q=draft%20age\u0026geo=US\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea spike\u003c/a\u003e in Google searches for “draft age.” That’s because a U.S. airstrike killed top Iranian general Qassem Suleimani, and Iran \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/thousands-mourn-those-killed-u-s-strikes-world-awaits-iran-n1110391?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evowed\u003c/a\u003e to retaliate.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne form that retribution might take? Cyberattacks, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/01/03/cyber-attack-should-be-expected-us-strike-iranian-leader-sparks-fears-major-digital-disruption/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexperts say\u003c/a\u003e. Over the past 10 years, Iranian hackers have proven they can throw a serious wrench into U.S. company operations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn 2012 and 2013, \u003c/strong\u003eIran responded to U.S. sanctions \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/aa3ddd9dd24b79f8ec76aa1a6487e4fc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eby taking aim\u003c/a\u003e at Wall Street. State-backed hackers \u003ca href=\"https://money.cnn.com/2012/09/27/technology/bank-cyberattacks/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einundated\u003c/a\u003e major financial institutions' websites with traffic, forcing them to shut down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn 2014,\u003c/strong\u003e Iranian hackers \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-05/iranian-attack-on-adelson-provides-lesson-on-cyber-strategy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e a malware attack on the networks used by Sheldon Adelson’s Las Vegas casino after the mogul suggested the U.S. should drop a bomb in the Iranian desert. It cost at least $40 million to recover.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJust three months ago, \u003c/strong\u003eMicrosoft \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/04/iran-tried-hack-us-presidential-candidates-journalists-effort-that-targeted-hundreds-microsoft-finds/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e a group tied to Iran tried to hack into the email accounts of U.S. presidential campaign workers, government officials, and journalists. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe newest cyberweapon = disinformation. Last year, social platforms like Facebook and Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/07/25/its-not-just-russians-anymore-iranians-others-turn-up-disinformation-efforts-ahead-vote/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised alarm\u003c/a\u003e about Iranian propaganda efforts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, the Philadelphia Fed published \u003ca href=\"https://www.philadelphiafed.org/research-and-data/regional-economy/indexes/leading?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea report\u003c/a\u003e that projected nine states’ economies will shrink in the next six months, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-02/nine-states-face-economic-contraction-most-since-2009-crisis?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest number\u003c/a\u003e of states at risk of contraction since July 2009. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWest Virginia’s facing the biggest hit, and Pennsylvania’s expected decline would be its steepest since May 2009. That could be bad news for President Trump, who’s facing reelection and won Pennsylvania by the skin of his teeth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Every month, the Philadelphia Fed releases six-month growth projections based on figures like housing permits, initial unemployment claims, interest rate spreads, and manufacturing data from the Institute for Supply Management.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe bank had already projected shrinkage for Delaware, Montana, Oklahoma, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, and Alaska. This month, it added Vermont, New Jersey, Kentucky, and Connecticut, while changing its tune on Alaska.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBright side: \u003c/strong\u003eThis means the bank expects 41 states to grow and the national economy to maintain its record expansion, with support from low interest rates, a gangbusters labor market, and a pending \"phase one\" trade deal with China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you see your single coworkers in finger splints this morning, cut them some slack. They were ferociously swiping yesterday on Dating Sunday, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/dating-sunday-tips-for-making-the-most-of-online-datings-busiest-day/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiest day of the year\u003c/a\u003e for online dating platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMatch projected 80% more user activity than average.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBumble predicted a 30% jump in new users.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn Dating Sunday last year, the app Coffee Meets Bagel \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1777921/the-best-day-to-be-active-on-dating-apps/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaw\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a 61% increase in new user signups and a 22% increase in matches compared to the previous 30 days. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eThe first Sunday of January has \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/01/02/dating-sunday-holiday-january-5-tips/2793853001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall the ingredients\u003c/a\u003e of a potent love elixir. Sunday is already the most popular day for swiping, Valentine’s Day is fast approaching, and singles just made New Year’s resolutions to find the Morning to their Brew. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eOnline dating is big business. Match Group, which owns apps like Tinder, Hinge, and OkCupid, posted revenue of more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.dallasnews.com/business/local-companies/2020/01/03/match-gears-up-for-another-record-breaking-weekend-of-online-dating-as-dating-sunday-approaches/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.7 billion\u003c/a\u003e last year (mostly thanks to Tinder). Match is currently being \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/11/iac-shares-jump-after-it-announces-plans-to-spin-off-match-group.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espun off\u003c/a\u003e by holding company IAC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
